info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:32PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton and north central Fulton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Caroga Lake, or 15 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arietta, Shaker Place, Powley Place, Averys Place and Whitehouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
